page.title: 09BALQUHIDDER SCHOOL
page.content: The local Primary School was{built in {1860}by Carnegie of Stronvar. It accommodated in one main room upto 60 children aged from 5 to 14 years. In 1965 the school was extended and at that time it had two teachers and accommodated 32 children aged from 5 to 11 years. For the last decade the school has had a{single teacher}and presently has a{roll of 16 children. The children come from up to 6 miles away and all but three children are conveyed to school by taxi, the taxi driver being a local farmer. The community takes a great deal of interest in the school and is very supportive. At Christmas and Hallowe'en parties are given for the children in the village hall and the local people delight in attending school functions.
